results.title: The Magic box
results.creator_credit: Richard Best, John Boulting, Ronald Neame and Festival Film Production
results.brief_description: A dramatised biography of William Friese-Greene (1855-1921), a British pioneer of the cinema. Adapted by Eric Ambler from the controversial biography by Ray Allister, the film contends that Friese-Greene was the true father of motion pictures, rather than the better known Thomas Edison. Told largely in flashback, the film details Friese-Greene’s tireless experimentation with the moving-image which mostly ended in failure and which eventually cost him his family and his reputation. The legitimacy of the claims for Friese-Greene became a central issue in the criticism of the film. Made for the 1951 Festival of Britain, ‘The Magic Box’ features Robert Donat in the lead role and a huge supporting cast including such British film luminaries as Joyce Grenfell, Miles Malleson, Michael Redgrave, Eric Portman, Emlyn Williams, Richard Attenborough, Peter Ustinov, Cecil Parker, Kay Walsh, and Laurence Olivier.

results.title: Private Benjamin
results.creator_credit: Howard Zieff, Harvey Miller, Charles Shyer, Nancy Meyers and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Private Benjamin is a pampered upper-middle-class Judy Benjamin, widowed on her wedding night. She enlists for a three-year, all-expenses-paid sojourn in the U.S Army, or so she was informed by a persuasive recruiter while trying to decide what to do with her life. With such unrealistic expectations, the results can only be disastrously funny - and they are - in this now-classic tale of a fish-out-of-water coming of age via the rigors of basic training and European adventures that test her new independence.

results.title: The Hunger
results.brief_description: The Hunger seamlessly melds gothic horror with a chic, contemporary edge in this erotic tale of sex, blood and desire. The icily beautiful vampire Miriam (Catherine Deneuve) and her latest consort, John (David Bowie), spend their nights scanning the hottest nightclubs in New York for new prey. When John suddenly begins to age at an alarming rate, they seek out Sarah Roberts (Susan Sarandon), a doctor researching links between blood disease and ageing. Disbelieving at first, Sarah rapidly becomes enmeshed in the nightmarish reality of Miriam’s world. Based upon the novel of the same name by best-selling author Whitley Strieber.

results.title: The Pelican brief
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Pieter Jan Brugge and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A law student (Julia Roberts) turns her suspicions about the deaths of two Supreme Court Justices into a speculative brief that has the potential to rock the highest levels of government. She and a determined investigative reporter (Denzel Washington) want to expose the scandal to the world, the only challenge is to live to tell the tale. This suspenseful film is based on the best-selling thriller by John Grisham.

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.title: Batman returns
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Tim Burton continues to give this popular comic book hero his own fractured spin in this moody, atmospheric sequel to “Batman” (1989), primarily drawing influence from the darkness of the original comic conceptualised by Bob Kane in the 1939. This time, the angst-ridden Batman (Michael Keaton) must save Gotham City from plunging into chaos after the sociopathic Penguin (Danny De Vito) surfaces to reclaim his birthright, then plots and schemes a path to mayorhood, aided by the evil industrialist Max Schreck (Christopher Walken). Shreck inadvertently creates another problem for the caped crusader after his browbeaten secretary Selena Kyle (Michelle Pfeiffer) mysteriously metamorphoses into Catwoman after a bad day at the office. Batman suddenly finds he has his hands full trying to expose the corrupt workings of the Penguin’s rise to prominence while fighting his attraction to the felonious feline whom is determined to kill him. Set amidst a world of fairground freaks and the surreal, noirish space of Gotham City, this film explores the duality of human nature and the fine line that separates the heroes from the villains.

results.title: Friday the 13th
results.creator_credit: Sean S. Cunningham and Georgetown productions
results.brief_description: At last count Friday the 13th is about to embark into its tenth sequel (it also spun off briefly into a television series) a dubious achievement for a film which was essentially a cheap imitation of John Carpenter’s seminal slasher film Halloween (1978). It also inspired a series of horror films set around commemorative and public holidays (Mothers day, My bloody valentine, April fool’s day, Silent night, deadly night etc..) and launched the careers of Kevin Bacon and horror make-up artist Tom Savini. This however is where all the slasher rules and cliches began. Starting off in 1958, two teenage camp counselors are brutally murdered by an unknown assailant at Camp Crystal lake. Flashing forward 20 years on and a new group of counselors have ascended onto the camp, affectionately dubbed by the wary locals as ‘Camp blood’. Soon enough the body count begins to pile up as the horny teens get dispatched in various gruesome scenarios, all the while ignoring the blatent signs that this is not a good place to be. Cast includes Betsy Palmer, Adrienne King, Harry Crosby, Laurie Bartram, Mark Nelson, Jeannine Taylor, Robbi Morgan

results.title: Batman forever
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Peter MacGregor Scott, Tim Burton and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The third film in the Batman series, based on the comic book character created by Bob Kane introduces Batman’s sidekick Robin. Gotham City millionnaire Bruce Wayne (Val Kilmer) a renowned playboy who’s charms attract the attention of psychologist Dr Chase Meridian (Nicole Kidman). Bruce trys to hide his alternate persona as Batman from her, as well as from his new ward acrobat Dick Grayson (Chris O’Donnell). This proves to be difficult when Two-Face (Tommy Lee Jones) and The Riddler (Jim Carrey) and their henchman try to brainwash the people of Gotham City.

results.title: Copycat
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, Mark Tarlov, Michael Nathanson, Arnon Milchan, John Fiedler, Joseph Caracciolo Jr and Regency Enterprises
results.brief_description: A murderer is on the loose in San Francisco, constantly staying one step ahead of the police. Criminal psychologist and noted author Helen Hudson (Signourney Weaver) notices the killer’s pattern. He is a copycat and is imitating the serial killers in one of Helen’s novels. She reports this to the police and assists Homicide detective Monahan (Holly Hunter) in the investigation, depsite being agoraphobic and unable to leave home. As their investigation gets closer the catching the killer, they realise his real target is Helen and she must fight to stay alive.

results.title: Lethal weapon 4
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In this fourth instalment of the Lethal Weapon series Mel Gibson and Danny Glover reprise their roles as Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh - a pair of mismatched police detectives who over the course of their relationship have learnt to love and appreciate each other’s contrasting styles. The over-the-top opening sequence establishes what the film has in store - glib throwaway lines, explosive action segments and faint hints at the importance of friendship to these two old buddies. Both Martin and Roger face a period of transition - Martin is to become a father (with Internal Affairs officer Lorna Cole - played by Rene Russo) whilst Roger is to become a grandfather. And the bad guys? Well represented by the Chinese triads who are involved with an illegal people-smuggling ring. Highlights of this film are the fight sequences, featuring Asian star Jet Li, staged by Hong Kong director Corey Yuen. Chris Rock (utilising his signature frenetic comedic shtick) plays a new cop on the block with unstinting passion for his job.

results.title: The Green berets
results.creator_credit: Ray Kellogg, John Wayne, Michael Wayne, Seven Arts, Warner Bros Pictures and Batjac Productions
results.brief_description: After extensive training, Colonel Michael Kirby selects two platoons from the U.S. Special forces - known as the Green Berets - for guerilla warfare at Anang. The soldiers are needed to widen the ‘killing zone’ around a Strike Camp in Viet Cong Territory. One of the most controversial movies about the Vietnamese Conflict, ‘Green berets’ stars John Wayne and David Janssen.
